Welcome!
Care Fiction is a thinking toy for commoning co-fabulation.
The practice of ‘commoning’ consists in the horizontal access, maintenance and governance – in a word, care – of shared resources, such as water, food, knowledge, space. We all encountered ‘commons’ in our lived experience: a communal garden, an open source software, a co-housing project. Commons can be material and immaterial.

By bringing to the foreground the phase 0 of the social enterprise process – the dreaming stage – we hope to provide a playful space for ‘commoning thinking.’
Guided by the anarchic cooperation of the ants colonies, we defined an uncontrolled and decentralized playground. Any anonymous agent can co-write an existing fiction or decide to start a new one, add images, throw ideas into the pot, reconfigure previous ones. The website itself is hosted by all the agents, who become nodes once they join.

We set the game in motion by offering a physical place to start thinking from: an abandoned house in Eindhoven. The story opens in a near future when a commoning is already happening there: How does it look like? Who has access to it? How are decisions made?

This project is part of STIGMERGY, a Design Academy Eindhoven seminar and exhibition curated by Martina Muzi in spring 2020. We are three students who share the interest in commoning. Feel free to get more involved, send us an email. eleonoratoniolo@fastmail.com elias.rhouzlane@gmail.com francesca.tambussi@gmail.com

EXTRA NOTES ON THE SITE ARCHITECTURE

#### Care Fiction is decentralized.
By using the app, you become one node of the mesh. The fiction you see,
write or act on is distributed among all the nodes, which means, all
current visitors share between them the content of the site.
The text you read, the image you upload, the sketch you draw, the vote
you make, all this is shared and synchronized between all of us.

#### It's peer-to-peer, like torrents.
To ensure availability of the content, even when you are the only
visitor, there is a special visitor, a 24h connected visitor, who is in
reality a computer living in a datacenter somewhere in France.

#### There is no central authority. The responsability is shared.
The proposed website is one application built on top of this distributed
network of Care Fiction(s).
Hosted in a server the application only serve an almost empty
"index.html" file that hold the algorithm to connect us all, fill the
screen with the distributed content and give tools to let you add to the
chain of content.
Yet, any developer is able to innovate by creating new applications, new
websites, all while reusing existing data that was created here, by you,
by us. Because we own the data both conceptually and physically.

#### A collective effort
To make it possible, we are reusing the efforts of the open source
community, including Prof. Tim Berners-Lee work, inventor of the World
Wide Web who advocates for a redesign of the web authority and for true
data ownership (see the Solid Project). In our case, this project is
built apon the Gun framework to whom we are grateful.
- The Code: https://github.com/nestarz/carefiction
- The Solid Project: https://solid.mit.edu/
- The Gun Framework: https://gun.eco/
